comment.author: 73129620@N00
comment._content: Currently, the sport of this "varsity line-up" is unlisted.  Judging from the dock and what might be oars at bottom left, this might be Yale's crew team.

comment.author: 39456037@N00
comment._content:
Yes, this is the dock in front of the Yale boathouse in Gales Ferry, CT.
It's still there.  I grew up there.

comment._content: I take it that the jockstrap hadn't yet been invented...

comment._content: See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2162713377/ for another photo at same time and place.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content:
this photo is listed as "June 22, 1911. Yale rowing team" at shorpy.com but it doesn't say why, however, if it is accurate, and it could be because this would be the time they were in Oxford UK for the annual regatta and might present a photo op. 
The NYT article 4 days before this date lists the postions as follows:
8 A. A. Low, Jr
7 Dixon Van Blarcom (studied Finance)
6 Jesse Philbin (skull and bones!)
5 Radcliffe Romeyn 
4 Tucker
3 Jim Scully Jr (all american football 1911)
2 J W Field Yale football coach the next year
1 Elliot P Frost team captain
